get.summary: Retrieve the shortest path money flow between two addresses
get.description:
Retrieves the shortest path between two addresses on a specified blockchain network.

**Traversal Behavior:**The system will perform a **Breadth-First Search (BFS)** to find the shortest path between the starting address and the target address.

parameters.name: assets

schema.description: List of assets to filter by. Use ['all'] for all assets. Defaults to network's native asset.
schema.title: Assets

parameters.description: List of assets to filter by. Use ['all'] for all assets. Defaults to network's native asset.

get.description:
Retrieves the money flows for addresses on a specified blockchain network with filtering options to reduce noise.

**Traversal Behavior:**
The system will perform a **Depth-First Search (DFS)** and return every discovered path.

parameters.name: direction

schema.description: The direction of the money flow

parameters.description: The direction of the money flow

parameters.name: assets

schema.description: List of assets to filter by. Use ['all'] for all assets. Defaults to network's native asset.
schema.title: Assets

parameters.description: List of assets to filter by. Use ['all'] for all assets. Defaults to network's native asset.

get.summary: Retrieve money flows by Transaction ID
get.description:
Retrieves the money flows for addresses involved in a transaction on a specified blockchain network.

**Traversal Behavior:**The system will perform a **Depth-First Search (DFS)** and return every discovered path.

parameters.name: assets

schema.description: List of assets to filter by. Use ['all'] for all assets. Defaults to network's native asset.
schema.title: Assets

parameters.description: List of assets to filter by. Use ['all'] for all assets. Defaults to network's native asset.

get.summary: Retrieve Recent Money Flows by Block Height
get.description:
Retrieves the most recent money flows between addresses on a specified blockchain network.

**Traversal Behavior:**The system will perform a **Depth-First Search (DFS)** and return every discovered path.

parameters.name: assets

schema.description: List of assets to filter by. Use ['all'] for all assets. Defaults to network's native asset.
schema.title: Assets

parameters.description: List of assets to filter by. Use ['all'] for all assets. Defaults to network's native asset.

post.summary: Find addresses with similar patterns using vector similarity search
post.description:
Retrieves addresses with similar patterns based on vector embeddings.

**Search Behavior:**
The system will perform a vector similarity search using the specified embedding type to find the most similar addresses based on their embedding vectors.

**Usage Examples:**
1. To find addresses similar to a reference address, set query_type to 'by_address' and provide a reference_address.
2. To find addresses matching a specific network pattern, set query_type to 'by_network_pattern' and provide a network_pattern.

parameters.name: embedding_type

schema.description: Type of embedding to use for similarity search

parameters.description: Type of embedding to use for similarity search

parameters.name: query_type

schema.description: How to specify the search query

parameters.description: How to specify the search query

parameters.name: reference_address

schema.description: Reference address to use as the query vector when query_type is 'by_address'
schema.title: Reference Address

parameters.description: Reference address to use as the query vector when query_type is 'by_address'

parameters.name: limit

schema.description: Number of similar addresses to retrieve
schema.title: Limit

parameters.description: Number of similar addresses to retrieve

get.description:
Retrieves historical balance snapshots for a specific address on a blockchain network.

This endpoint provides a paginated list of balance snapshots at fixed 4-hour intervals, showing free, reserved, staked, and total balances along with changes between periods. Optionally filter by time range and assets.

parameters.name: page_size

schema.description: Number of balance snapshots per page
schema.title: Page Size

parameters.description: Number of balance snapshots per page

parameters.name: assets

schema.description: List of assets to filter by. Use ['all'] for all assets. Defaults to network's native asset.
schema.title: Assets

parameters.description: List of assets to filter by. Use ['all'] for all assets. Defaults to network's native asset.

get.description:
Retrieves the latest balance snapshot for a specific address on a blockchain network.

This endpoint returns the most recent balance data including free, reserved, staked, and total balances for the specified address and assets.

get.description:
Retrieves balance changes analysis for a specific address on a blockchain network.

This endpoint provides a paginated list of balance changes, showing periods where the balance changed along with the magnitude of changes. Results are ordered by change magnitude (largest changes first).

schema.description: Number of balance changes per page
schema.title: Page Size

schema.description: Minimum absolute change threshold to filter by (in token units)
schema.title: Min Change Threshold

parameters.description: Minimum absolute change threshold to filter by (in token units)

get.description:
Retrieves balance aggregations for daily, weekly, or monthly periods.

This endpoint provides aggregated balance data over different time periods, showing end-of-period balances and cumulative changes. Useful for trend analysis and reporting across multiple addresses and assets.

schema.description: List of addresses to filter by. If not provided, returns data for all addresses.

get.description:
Retrieves network-wide balance activity volume metrics over time.

This endpoint provides aggregated balance activity data showing the volume of balance changes across all addresses for each time period. It includes metrics like active addresses count, total balance change volumes, and breakdowns by balance type (free, reserved, staked). Results are grouped by time periods and assets, useful for analyzing network-wide balance activity trends.

parameters.name: page_size

schema.description: Number of volume series records per page
schema.title: Page Size

parameters.description: Number of volume series records per page

parameters.name: assets

schema.description: List of assets to filter by. Use ['all'] for all assets. Defaults to network's native asset.
schema.title: Assets

parameters.description: List of assets to filter by. Use ['all'] for all assets. Defaults to network's native asset.

get.description:
Retrieves transaction history for a specific address on a blockchain network.

This endpoint provides a paginated list of transactions involving the specified address, either as sender or receiver. Optionally, you can filter transactions between the specified address and a target address.

parameters.name: assets

schema.description: List of assets to filter by. Use ['all'] for all assets. Defaults to network's native asset.
schema.title: Assets

parameters.description: List of assets to filter by. Use ['all'] for all assets. Defaults to network's native asset.

get.description:
Retrieves balance transfers volume series data providing network-wide transfer activity metrics.

This endpoint provides paginated balance transfers volume series data showing network activity metrics like transaction counts per period, transfer volumes per period, active addresses per period, and other network activity indicators. Supports different time aggregations (4-hour, daily, weekly, monthly) and filtering by assets and time range.

parameters.name: page_size

schema.description: Number of volume series records per page
schema.title: Page Size

parameters.name: assets

schema.title: Assets

parameters.description: List of assets to filter by. Use ['all'] for all assets. Defaults to network's native asset.

get.description:
Retrieves comprehensive analytics for a list of addresses from the balance transfers system.

This endpoint provides detailed analytics including volume in/out, transaction patterns, counterparty analysis, time-based activity patterns, volume distributions, and address classification for each address-asset combination. Perfect for bulk address analysis.

Use `return_all=true` to get all results without pagination.

schema.description: List of blockchain addresses to analyze
schema.title: Addresses
